sols_html:
Differentiating term-by-term and using the chain rule, we obtain:

\[\begin{aligned} y'(x) &= (e^{\sin x}+x)' \\ &= e^{\sin x} \cdot (\sin x)' + 1 \\ &= e^{\sin x} \cos x + 1 \\ \\ y'(0) &= e^{\sin(0)} \cos(0) + 1 \\ &= e^{0} \cdot 1 + 1 \\ &= 2\end{aligned}\]

The equation of the tangent line is therefore:

\[\begin{aligned} y &= 2(x-0)+1 \\ &= {\color{blue}2x+1}\end{aligned}\]
